chargeHist.descr: Hit and Run - Resulting in Death

result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric E. Banaszak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run - Resulting in Death, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.   Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. Defendant is to complete a Financial Literacy Program.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Hit and Run - Resulting in Death

records.addlTxt: 2:05 pm case called. Defendant Eric E. Banaszak in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSI received by all parties, no material corrections or additions by either counsel. Statements by victims family members. Statement by defendant's father. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Szilagyi. Statement by Defendant. Statement by Court prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: 15 Years Wisconsin State Prison to be served as 8.5 years Initial Confinement and 6.5 years Extended Supervision. Credit for 230 days credit for time served. CONDITIONS OF ES: Complete a financial literacy course, AODA and follow through, Absolute Sobriety, No Bars, Defendant is not to possess or ingest any impairing substances without a valid prescription from a treating physician. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA sample to be provided. Up to 25% of inmate earnings during confinement. DL revocation for 5 years. Defendant is eligible for CIP & SAP, provided he is statutorily eligible. Appeal Rights Given.

Case Called @ 2:25 PM: Defendant Eric E. Banaszak in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State believes matter will move forward to resolution with plea today and a request for PSI be completed.  State recites terms of sentencing that will be proposed.  SPD believes that defense will be free to argue as to terms of sentencing.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Def BOT.  INFO filed.  INFO Stated - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 INFO:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Upon request of counsel, PSI ordered.  SEH Scheduled - NOH Given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi not present in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The court will schedule a plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott Blader/Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD:  Some discovery has been exchanged.  Still awaiting documentation on accident report and final autopsy report.  ADA agrees that  still awaiting info on toxicology.  Further STC Scheduled.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 09:05 am.
